question: 志
sourceMnemonic: The kanji and the word are exactly the same. That means they share meanings as well.
sourceReadingMnemonic: When you have the <vocabulary>ambition</vocabulary> to do something, it feels like you're pointing at it with your heart. To say "heart pointing" in Japanese, you could say <ja><reading>心ざし</reading></ja> (<ja>こころざし</ja>), which is how this word was written in classical Japanese. In modern Japanese it's always <ja>志</ja>, but the reading is exactly the same. Now get out there and heart point to your dreams!
